quest.name: Under the Moonlight
journal: Alisaie seems ready to bid farewell to Doma.
Alisaie declares the Scions' work in Doma done, and turns her gaze towards Rhalgr's Reach. Lyse will want to hear of Zenos's rumored resurrection...

Lyse reacts to the news of Zenos's return with predictable disbelief, but Thancred is on hand to propose a simple─if somewhat unsavory─way of settling the matter. Journey to Bloodhowe in the Lochs, and inspect the crown prince's mortal remains.

You heave aside the weighty stone lid atop Zenos's resting place, but contrary to Thancred's predictions, find no writhing snakes or scuttling spiders waiting for you within. The coffin is empty. Leaving Thancred to track down the workers responsible for interring the late viceroy, you prepare to return to the Rising Stones with Alisaie. The other Scions must hear of this development, and the possibility that an Ascian now holds court in Garlemald.

You arrive to find that Alisaie has already made a full report to Urianger via linkpearl. Soon after, you are joined by Y'shtola, who listens carefully to the facts before agreeing that Ascian possession is indeed the most likely explanation. It would seem that Alphinaud has entered into a deadly web of intrigue, and Alisaie cannot help but worry for her brother's safety...
objectives: Speak with Lyse in Rhalgr's Reach.
Speak with Alisaie at the Rising Stones.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: Doma owes you a great debt, my friend. Thanks to you, we have everything we need to prosper. You and Alisaie must promise to visit us again soon. And Alphinaud, too, when he returns from the Empire. Know that my thoughts go with him...

dialogue.name: YUGIRI
dialogue.text: However far his pilgrimage may take him, we have not seen the last of Gosetsu. Of that I am certain.

dialogue.name: KIENKANGATEKEEPER03028
dialogue.text: Lord Hien is expecting you. May I show you in?

dialogue.name: EVENTAREA
dialogue.text: Enter the Kienkan?

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: I think it's time we were going, don't you? We've done all we can here, and we have a lot to report.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: But before we head back to the Rising Stones, let's call in at Rhalgr's Reach. We should be the ones to tell Lyse about Zenos. After everything we went through together, we owe her that.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text:
Forename! Alisaie! You're back!
...Hm? No Alphinaud?

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: It's good to see you, Lyse. As for my headstrong brother, he's off on what will almost certainly turn out to be a once-in-a-lifetime trip to Garlemald.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: It's a long story, but...we have evidence that Zenos might still be alive.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: What!? But that's─ If this is a joke─ Gods, this had better be a joke!

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: Look─I know what I saw, all right? We all saw it. And here you are saying he's alive and well and living the high life back in Garlemald!?

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: I know how ludicrous this sounds. I'm still having difficulty believing it myself. But while I might doubt the word of an imperial envoy, I'm inclined to trust Forename's. SheHe saw the crown prince through the Echo─in a meeting that could only have taken place in the recent past.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: It was him. It was Zenos.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Zenos is alive.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: No, it must have been─I don't know─some kind of...really convincing impostor. Zenos is dead. He had a great big hole in his neck! We buried him!

dialogue.name: MNAAGO
dialogue.text: Aye, and someone went to the trouble of desecrating the bastard's grave, remember?

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: (-???-)Thal's gilded...halls. Whatever are you talking about?

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: Thancred! What brings you to the Reach?

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Alphinaud had me lending a hand at the Saltery─keeping an eye on the rebuilding work and so on─just until operations were up and running. And now that they are, I thought I might look in on you before wending my weary way back to headquarters.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Forgive me if I misheard, but is there some suggestion the late crown prince could have...gotten better? If so, might I suggest a quick look inside his coffin as our first order of business?

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: Eurgh. As much as I hated the man, it doesn't feel right defiling his grave. But if it will put this rumor to rest, I suppose we have to. And when there are no curious eyes about, if we can manage it.

dialogue.name: MNAAGO
dialogue.text: Zenos is buried up at Bloodhowe in the Lochs. His grave was set apart from the others and left unmarked, so as not to upset the locals.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: Then it shouldn't be too hard to find. Naago, you're in charge until I get back!

dialogue.name: MNAAGO
dialogue.text: You'll find Zenos's grave up at Bloodhowe, the burial ground in the Lochs. The stone isn't marked, but it's set apart from the others, so it should be obvious enough which one you're after.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Most of the graves are grouped together, but they managed to find a lonely spot for Zenos, didn't they...

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: My money is on writhing snakes. Possibly spiders. Let's prise it open and see what comes out.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: This is it... Gods, he'd better be in there. Someone scrawled all over the stone a while ago, but I had it scrubbed off, and thought no more about it...

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: So no one thought to check if the coffin was still occupied? Well then, we are presented with but one course of action.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: And we had best be sure we are not observed in the doing of it. Shall we begin?

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: If there's no corpse, then...are we to conclude the rumors are true?

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Not necessarily. We might still be dealing with a doppelganger of some kind. An agent could have been sent to dispose of the body in a bid to lend credence to the tale of Zenos's resurrection.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: More and more, however, I find myself siding with Alphinaud's theory of Ascian possession. Speaking from experience, I can tell you they have no qualms about taking a living host, let alone a dead one...

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: You're saying an Ascian is walking around in Zenos's body?

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: It seems a distinct possibility. Once I have put this grave back the way we found it, I shall pay a visit to the people responsible for interring the crown prince.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Before leaping to any conclusions, I want to know for sure if a body was ever buried here...and how certain we are that Zenos was properly dead.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: If he wasn't, that was some trick. He as good as cut his own head off. Anyway, Raubahn needs to hear about this. If you find anything out, send word to me at Rhalgr's Reach.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: <sigh> I don't know why I'm surprised─with matters settling down in Doma, we were due another crisis.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Shall we make for the Rising Stones, then? It's past time we shared these developments with the others.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: I've spoken with Raubahn, and we've decided to keep quiet about Zenos until we have undeniable proof. There's no sense in upsetting everyone if there's a chance we're wrong.

dialogue.name: MNAAGO
dialogue.text: So the grave was empty. By Rhalgr... How many people did we lose bringing that bastard down─and now he might still be alive?

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text:
I have a question or two for the people in charge of burying Zenos...
You were headed back to the Rising Stones, were you not?

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: While I was waiting for you to arrive, I spoke with Urianger over linkpearl and gave him a full report. Y'shtola is on her way, and should be here any─ Ah.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Alisaie. Forename. 'Tis good to see you safe and well. What news have you from the East?

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: ...Disturbing developments indeed. Given all that we know, I too would conclude that an Ascian now inhabits Zenos's body. A doppelganger might fool the crown prince's subordinates, but Forename? Nay, Alphinaud had the right of it.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Would that his wisdom extended to the question of his own safety. Capable though he has become, he ventures alone into the enemy's stronghold─and the shadowy web of the Paragons, like as not.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: When it comes to making rash decisions, I'm hardly in a position to criticize, but...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: I'm worried. I just wish there were something I could do for him besides pray.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Meanwhile, in the imperial palace...

dialogue.name: VARIS
dialogue.text: We cannot suffer eikons to exist. Was I not clear on this point?

dialogue.name: ROBEMAN
dialogue.text: (-Zenos-)More than clear. The eikon in question was summarily dispatched by the Warrior of Light. The summoner is dead, and the rite beyond repeating.

dialogue.name: ROBEMAN
dialogue.text: (-Zenos-)Everything proceeded according to plan─every party behaving exactly as required.

dialogue.name: ROBEMAN
dialogue.text: (-Zenos-)My methods may seem extreme, but there is no cause for concern. I work only to ensure the salvation of this star.

dialogue.name: ROEGADYNSOLDIER
dialogue.text: Hm? What are you doing fiddling with that thing?

dialogue.name: ROEGADYNSOLDIER
dialogue.text: I asked you a question, soldier!

dialogue.name: ROEGADYNSOLDIER
dialogue.text: What are you─ Have you lost your mind!?

dialogue.name: ROEGADYNSOLDIER
dialogue.text: Aaah!

dialogue.name: KATANASOLDIER
dialogue.text: ...I have lost many things, but my mind is yet my own.

dialogue.name: KATANASOLDIER
dialogue.text: There upon the stage I stood, prepared to take my final bow, only to find that the finale was but an intermission...

dialogue.name: KATANASOLDIER
dialogue.text: Shall I use this chance to repent for my sins? Embrace goodness and mediocrity? Nay, I think not. While the one I yearn to face yet lives, the hunt must go on.
